data.title: HRH The Crown Prince Of Jordan Is Officially Engaged To Wed Ms Rajwa Al Saif Of Saudi Arabia
data.meta_description: The Royal Hashemite Court announced HRH The Crown Prince Of Jordan's proposal to Ms Rajwa Al Saif. Here's everything to know.
data.text:
We’re hearing wedding bells after The Royal Hashemite Court‘s announcement that His Royal Highness Crown Prince Al Hussein bin Abdullah II is engaged to be wed to Ms Rajwa Khaled bin Musaed bin Saif bin Abdulaziz Al Saif. According to the official statement, His Royal Highness proposed on Wednesday, 16 August 2022, with the blessing of Their Majesties King Abdullah II and Queen Rania Al Abdullah.

“The engagement took place at the home of Ms Rajwa’s father in Riyadh, and was attended by Their Royal Highnesses Prince El Hassan bin Talal, Prince Hashem bin Abdullah II, Prince Ali bin Al Hussein, Prince Hashim bin Al Hussein, Prince Ghazi bin Muhammad, and Prince Rashid bin El Hassan, in addition to members of the Al Saif family,” wrote The Royal Hashemite Court in its official statement. Adding that, “it extends its sincere congratulations to Their Majesties on this occasion, and wishes His Royal Highness Crown Prince Al Hussein bin Abdullah II and Ms Rajwa a lifetime of happiness.” The Royal Hashemite Court is not the only official to release its statement addressing the happy news. Queen Rania quickly sang her praises to her son and his wife-to-be in a teary Instagram post. “I didn’t think it was possible to hold so much joy in my heart,” wrote Queen Rania, adding a “congratulations to my eldest Prince Hussein and his beautiful bride-to-be, Rajwa.”
